page.title: 19MEETING OTHER PEOPLE
page.content: The oldest village club is the { {Cricket Club}founded in 1874. Mr Dick Gearing has been a club member for 54 years. He remembers Arthur Negus playing at Ampney Crucis. The{Football {Club}was restarted by the enthusiasm of its present captain, Graham Curtis, in 1978. They became top of the League in their first season. They are now in the Cirencester First League. Clubs meeting in the Village Hall are: Women's Royal British Legion (3rd Tuesday); 60 Club, started 1975, (alternate Mondays); W.I. (4th Thursday); Youth Club (Friday evenings in winter); Gardening Club (Thursday); Sequence Dancing (2nd & 4th Tuesdays). The Brownies meet at the school on Mondays. Tennis Club meets at Ash House court and the Hope court.
